benchmark_details.name: Gender Representation and Bias in Indian Civil Service Mock Interviews
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a novel dataset of 51,278 interview questions sourced from 888 YouTube videos of mock interviews. It demonstrates stark gender bias in the nature of questions asked to male and female candidates and showcases the dataset's utility for future social science studies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate gender bias in mock interviews for Indian civil service candidates and to provide a comprehensive dataset for further research.

data.source: 51,278 interview questions sourced from mock interviews on YouTube.
data.annotation: Transcriptions of videos using automatic speech recognition (ASR) and manual verification.

methodology.calculation: Gender bias scores calculated via differential analysis of question types asked to male and female candidates.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate stronger gender bias. A score close to 1 suggests balanced questioning.
methodology.validation: Results compared with ground truth data from UPSC candidate records.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Yes, the dataset includes gender breakdown of candidates.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential reinforcement of societal biases through biased interview questioning.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Publicly available data from YouTube mock interview videos.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Data usage falls under fair use for research purposes.
